name: autoperf
body:
### What is autoperf?
`autoperf` is a little open-source program for displaying Linux perf code profiling information in nicely formatted HTML reports, clearly highlighting hot functions and code sections. It may be useful for anyone tinkering with C or C++ performance profiling on Linux.

### Quickstart
After extracting the project tarball and profiling your binary file with `perf record` as usual, do:
```
$ cd [pathtoautoperf]
$ ./autoperf -i [somepath]/perf.data
```
And check the report in the template folder.

### Documentation
For further information on program usage, check our video overview at https://youtu.be/Toub5SpKUB8 and our project wiki at https://github.com/lucashmorais/autoperf/wiki.

### Package dependencies
* exuberant-ctags
* linux-tools-generic
* openjdk

### Tested Kernel versions
* Kernel 3.13
* Kernel 3.16

### Known issues
* Source code that may be subject to preprocessor modification may not be correctly annotated by autoperf.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
